job.title: DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
DevOps and Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) - Oracle SAAS Infrastructure Services Team   U.S. Citizenship or U.S. Lawful Permanent Resident Status Required  due to supporting Federal Government customers   Oracle is a leader in enterprise cloud applications powering many of the world’s largest organizations, and we’re in the process of revolutionizing our application user experiences with&nbsp;our&nbsp;new Redwood user interface components and enterprise-scale backend services.&nbsp;We are on a quest to&nbsp;provide the most productive platform with extremely&nbsp;fast, secure, and extensible REST services to back these user experiences.&nbsp;Our goal is to create a universal services and transaction services&nbsp;that is metadata-oriented and is simple to uptake, test, debug, and monitor.&nbsp;These services must be highly scalable and&nbsp;dynamic to meet the varying work loads for our customers.&nbsp;We have many large scale customers who are ready to work with you on this fabulous journey.&nbsp;We’re looking for talented DevOps/SRE engineers to build, deploy and monitor the service on Oracle Cloud. If&nbsp;you&nbsp;have&nbsp;experience as a DevOps engineer supporting CI/CD, rollout, patching, monitoring enterprise scalable micro services using cloud native&nbsp;infrastructure please contact us right away.   What You'll Do&nbsp;  - Bringing in the right “DevOps” mindset among the teams developing software, conducting&nbsp;training on tools and processes that makes software development and testing easier.   
  - Participate in the entire software Lifecycle – development, testing, CI and production operations   
  - Automate release and deployment process from development to production&nbsp;rollout following CI/CD process&nbsp;using standard DevOps toolset   
  - Define, enforce and maintain metrics and quality gates for build promotion&nbsp;processes   
  - Take ownership of maintaining and managing the environments. Maintain separation between Dev, UAT,&nbsp;stage and production environments.   
  - Monitor and maintain the production service and infrastructure   
  - Participate in on-call/Pagerduty for the service   
  - Work with customers and ISVs and service developers to troubleshoot issues in production systems.   
  - Mentor new employees and software developers to increase quality of projects   
   Required Knowledge and Skills  - B.S., M.S. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering with&nbsp;2-3 years of professional&nbsp;experience in&nbsp;Cloud&nbsp;Infrastructure and Cloud Solutions   
  - Professional work experience working on complex applications/services with DevOps Experience.   
  - Strong knowledge of Linux/UNIX Shell scripting, package management etc   
  - Hands on experience working with standard DevOps tools Kubernetes, Docker, Istio, Grafana, Helm Charts, Terraform   
  - Experience with&nbsp;Build&nbsp;Automation&nbsp;and Monitoring&nbsp;tools like Maven, ANT, Gradle, Jenkins bug tracking tools like JIRA   
  - Build Tools like Maven, ANT, Gradle,.   
  - Source control tools like Git, GitHub, SVN or equivalent   
  - Network configuration and management   
  - Knowledge of middleware components like Weblogic or Tomcat   
  - Knowledge of Python or Perl is desirable.   
  - Knowledge of Monitoring technologies (Enterprise Manager, Thousand Eyes, Prometheus) will be an advantage.   
  - Teamwork is key here.&nbsp;We are looking for developers who believe in the value of cross team collaboration.   
  - Excellent oral and written communication skills.   
  - Self motivated to continuously learn and improve.
